title: It's amazing how Riven can do 4 auto attacks and her 3 Q within 2 seconds yet called balanced
body:
This isn't intended at all, the animation cancelling, yet "Riven mains" will cry saying it is what makes Riven so strong as it's "hard" to do this.

How delusional are you people? This shouldn't ever happen, how the hell is it fair for her to do that much damage in lane then just disengage whenever she wants, and repeat this until she decides to kill you?

No its not, at least not in league.

Originally it was orb-walking in DOTA and it worked because the attack was a spell, so they would use the spell move spell move.  All it did was cut down on the lag or in laymans terms the part of the animation that was still playing but could be skipped because you were no longer locked out of motion or attacking without outright canceling the attack.

In league that doesn't exist like it did, but there is still the part of the animation that can be ended early without negative effects by issuing a move order immediately after the attack is fired.

And before you say i just described animation canceling, i didn't.

You are not actually cancelling the animation it still plays you are just overriding the unnecessary flourish with a move command.

On Riven it is actually animation canceling because of how the coding interacts.

Using her W for example this is the process of what happens.
Her W has a animation that freezes her in place for the cast, while {{item:3077}} can be cast without interruption.
So basically you time it in such away that they play at the same time and {{item:3077}}s animation plays instead.
This gives you the stun and damage of her w and the damage of Crescent with out the cast time.

This is an unintentional result of the coding, seeing as the different times they were added to the game, would make it very unlikely they would have noticed this interaction and fixed it.
When it was finally figured out, it was at that point that they probably made an executive decision to not fix it seeing as the resources, time, and manpower could be better spent elsewhere in the game made even more relevant by them nerfing her to the point that she isn't the all around clear best choice and is only played a lot by her diehard fans.

go into a game with nautilus if you have him. His auto attack animation is long as fuck. Im pretty sure you can cancel that animation with his e. Zed can cast his E while auto attacking and doesnt cancel the auto attack. Rengar can literally cast all of his spells mid leap. renekton also uses hydra to cancel w animation. Khazix can w+e to cancel the animation of his w. There is a pretty long list of champions that use animation cancelling, they just arent as prominent as riven. And yes orb walking IS animation cancelling because you are preventing the animation of the auto attack by moving in order to keep up with the target. You cancel the animation of your auto attacks, that is why it is called ANIMATION CANCELLING.

If you break down an ability or an auto attack it goes through 4 parts

cast --- animation --- damage --- backswing 

>go into a game with nautilus if you have him. His auto attack animation is long as fuck. Im pretty sure you can cancel that animation with his e. 

his AA damage doesn't go through if you do this. If you are doing it on the backswing then that isn't animation canceling because you have already had to go through the animation phase and you are backswing canceling.  

>Zed can cast his E while auto attacking and doesn't cancel the auto attack. 

his AA damage doesn't go through if you do this. or you have to go through his AA animation anyway if you want it to hit which isn't animation canceling because the damage has already gone through.  

> Rengar can literally cast all of his spells mid leap. 

his leap isn't a damaging spell, if you cast abilities during his leap his aa animation will reset upon arrival and you will get one less aa off. working as intended. 

>renekton also uses hydra to cancel w animation. 

yes hydra is part of the problem 

>Khazix can w+e to cancel the animation of his w. 

if his spikes are in the air then you are in the backswing phase of this spell, by then you are free to do what you want see explanation below, that isn't animation canceling its backswing canceling. 

>There is a pretty long list of champions that use animation cancelling, they just arent as prominent as riven. 

none of them will still get the damage to go through when you animation cancel though, and that's the point, if you animation cancel on other champs (tiamat excluded) the damage doesn't go through. on riven it does. 

>And yes orb walking IS animation cancelling because you are preventing the animation of the auto attack by moving in order to keep up with the target. You cancel the animation of your auto attacks, that is why it is called ANIMATION CANCELLING.

If you immediately cancel the auto attack the damage doesn't go through. 

orb walking is issuing a canceling command during the backswing phase and that is not animation canceling

riven can cancel during the animation phase, hence animation canceling, but the damage still goes through. 

any other ability that tries this has its damage canceled as well. you don't have to wait for the backswing to finish, but you do have to wait through the animation phase if you want to damage your target. 

If there is any delay between cast and damage, then you must wait to issue another command until after the damage has gone through. that is why there is a delay at all otherwise all spells would be instantaneous.

>And yes orb walking IS animation cancelling because you are preventing the animation of the auto attack by moving in order to keep up with the target. 

No.

You are canceling backswing, not cast point.

Cast point is not the same as backswing.

Cancelling cast point causes the ability to not play, due to the animation being interrupted. It is a balancing factor in skills, especially in DotA. It is an effective delay to abilities that may be overpowered, or cannot be respond to properly by enemy players, if it can be cast too quickly. 

Backswing is the flourish after casting and has no penalty whatsoever associated with it. In fact, it is always beneficial to cancel backswing because it doesn't do anything.

Orbwalking cancels the backswing of your attack so you don't waste time standing around for the backswing animation to finish and cover distance until the next time your autoattack finishes CD. 

If Orbwalking cancelled cast points, ADCs would be ranged Swains, shooting their AA missiles at you WHILE walking around. And that's not how it works.
